SEARCH
Package com.w10.risk_game.models

Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
com.w10.risk_game.models.GameEngine
public class GameEngine extends Object
The GameEngine class is responsible for managing the game map, players, and their interactions in a game.
Author:
Sherwyn Dsouza

  • Method Details

    • loadMap

      public void loadMap(String p_fileName)
      The function "loadMap" loads a map file, creates a game map object, and checks if the map is valid.
      Parameters:
      p_fileName - The parameter `p_fileName` is a String that represents the name of the file from which the map will be loaded.

    • showMap

      public void showMap()
      The function "showMap" displays the map in a tabular form with info such as continent id, country, bonus, etc.

    • createPlayer

      public void createPlayer(String p_playerName)
      The function creates a player with a given name and adds it to a map of players, checking for duplicate names.
      Parameters:
      p_playerName - The parameter "p_playerName" is a String that represents the name of the player being created.

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(String p_playerName)
      The function removes a player from a list of players in a game engine. It also randomly assigns the countries of the removed player to the remaining players
      Parameters:
      p_playerName - The parameter "p_playerName" is a String that represents the name of the player that needs to be removed.

    • showAllPlayers

      public void showAllPlayers()
      The function "showAllPlayers" prints the names of all players and the countries they own.

    • assignCountries

      public void assignCountries()
      The function assigns countries to players in a game, ensuring that each player receives at least one country.

    • assignPlayersReinforcements

      private void assignPlayersReinforcements()
      The function assigns reinforcements to each player in the game.

      The function returns the number of players in a game.
      Returns:
      The number of players in the list "this.d_players".

      The function returns the game map.

      The method is returning an object of type GameMap.

      public Player getPlayerDetails(String p_playerName)
      The function returns the details of a player based on their name.
      Parameters:
      p_playerName - The name of the player for which you want to retrieve the details.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a Player object.

    • editMap

      public boolean editMap(String p_mapFileName)
      The function `editMap` checks if a map file exists, loads it if it does, creates a new file if it doesn't, and returns a boolean indicating success or failure.
      Parameters:
      p_mapFileName - The parameter `p_mapFileName` is a String that represents the file name or path of the map file that needs to be edited.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value.

    • addContinent

      public void addContinent(int p_continentId, String p_ContinentName)
      The function adds a continent to a map editor and prints the output.
      Parameters:
      p_continentId - The p_continentId parameter is an integer that represents the unique identifier for the continent.
      p_ContinentName - The parameter "p_ContinentName" is a String that represents the name of the continent that you want to add.

    • addCountry

      public void addCountry(int p_countryId, String p_countryName, int p_continentId)
      The function adds a country to a map editor and prints the output.
      Parameters:
      p_countryId - The p_countryId parameter is an integer that represents the unique identifier for the country being added.
      p_countryName - The parameter "p_countryName" is a String that represents the name of the country that you want to add.
      p_continentId - The p_continentId parameter is an integer that represents the ID of the continent to which the country belongs.

    • removeContinent

      public void removeContinent(int p_continentId)
      The function removes a continent from a map in a game editor.
      Parameters:
      p_continentId - The parameter "p_continentId" is an integer that represents the ID of the continent that needs to be removed.

    • removeCountry

      public void removeCountry(int p_countryId)
      The function removes a country from the game map and updates the player's ownership if necessary.
      Parameters:
      p_countryId - The parameter `p_countryId` is an integer representing the ID of the country that needs to be removed.

    • addNeighbor

      public void addNeighbor(int p_countryId, int p_neighbourCountryId)
      The function adds a neighbor country to a given country in a map editor.
      Parameters:
      p_countryId - The p_countryId parameter represents the ID of the country to which you want to add a neighbor.
      p_neighbourCountryId - The parameter "p_neighbourCountryId" represents the ID of the neighboring country that you want to add to the country with the ID "p_countryId".

    • removeNeighbor

      public void removeNeighbor(int p_countryId, int p_neighbourCountryId)
      The function removes a neighbor country from a given country in a map editor.
      Parameters:
      p_countryId - The p_countryId parameter represents the ID of the country from which you want to remove a neighbor.
      p_neighbourCountryId - The parameter "p_neighbourCountryId" represents the ID of the neighbor country that you want to remove from the country with ID "p_countryId".

    • removeCountryFromPlayer

      private void removeCountryFromPlayer(int p_countryId, Player p_player)
      The function removes a specific country from a player's list of owned countries.
      Parameters:
      p_countryId - The ID of the country that needs to be removed from the player's list of owned countries.
      p_player - The parameter "p_player" is of type Player and represents the player from whom the country needs to be removed.

    • checkIfMapIsValid

      public boolean checkIfMapIsValid()
      The function checks if a game map is valid and prints a corresponding message.
      Returns:
      a boolean value indicate if the game map is valid

    • checkIfGameCanBegin

      private boolean checkIfGameCanBegin()
      The function checks if the game can begin by verifying if the map is created, there are at least two players, and countries have been assigned.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value.

    • startGameLoop

      public void startGameLoop()
      The startGameLoop function checks if the game can begin and then iterates through the players, allowing each player to issue an order.

    • startExecution

      private void startExecution()
      The startExecution function iterates through each player and executes their orders.

    • saveMap

      public void saveMap(String p_mapFileName)
      The function saves the game map to a file if it is valid, otherwise it prints an error message.
      Parameters:
      p_mapFileName - The name of the file where the map will be saved.
